utilities

Class Fractal

  • java.lang.Object
    • utilities.Fractal

  • public class Fractal
extends java.lang.Object
    Generates floats in a 2D array using the DiamondSqaure algorithm.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    OSM Group 5 - DollyWood project

    • Method Detail

      • generateFractal

        public static float[][] generateFractal(float[][] map,
                        float max,
                        float min,
                        float randomRange,
                        float randomDiv)
        Fills map with floats which are calculated with the DiamondSquare algorithm. The floats will have a value between 0 and 255.
        Parameters:
        map - The array which will be filled.
        max - Used to calculate the max value for the initial corners.
        min - Used to calculate the minimal value for the initial corners
        randomRange - A value in this range will be added to every position in the array when the value is calculated
        randomDiv - The randomRange will be divided by this every recursive call.
        Returns:
        map filled with floats.

      • intitateCorners

        public static float[][] intitateCorners(float[][] map,
                        float max,
                        float min,
                        float randomRange)
        Fills the corners of map with a value between (max-min)/2 + randomRange and (max-min)/2 - randomRange.
        Parameters:
        map - The array which will be used.
        max - Used to calculate the values for the corners.
        min - Used to calculate the values for the corners.
        randomRange - Used to calculate the values for the corners.
        Returns:
        map with the corner spots filled with values.

      • diamondSquare

        public static float[][] diamondSquare(float[][] map,
                      int xSide,
                      int ySide,
                      float randomRange,
                      float randomDiv)
        Executes the diamond and square step of the Diamond-Square algorithm.
        Parameters:
        map - The array which will be used.
        xSide - The width of the squares, from corner to corner. Or the distance between the right and left edge of a diamond.
        ySide - The height of the squares, from corner to corner. Or the distance between the upper and lower edge of a diamond.
        randomRange - The random number which is added in every step will be within this range.
        randomDiv - The randomRange is divided with this every recursive call.
        Returns:
        The array filled with floats, generated with Diamond-Square algorithm.

      • diamondStep

        public static float[][] diamondStep(float[][] map,
                    int xSide,
                    int ySide,
                    float randomRange)
        Executes the diamond step of the Diamond-Square algorithm. Taking a square of four points, generate a random value at the square midpoint, where the two diagonals meet. The midpoint value is calculated by averaging the four corner values, plus a random amount. This gives you diamonds when you have multiple squares arranged in a grid.
        Parameters:
        map - The array which will be used.
        xSide - The width of the squares.
        ySide - The height of the squares.
        randomRange - The random value will be in this range.
        Returns:
        map with diamonds calculated.

      • squareStep

        public static float[][] squareStep(float[][] map,
                   int xSide,
                   int ySide,
                   float randomRange)
        Executes the square step of the Diamond-Square algorithm. Taking each diamond of four points, generate a random value at the center of the diamond. Calculate the midpoint value by averaging the corner values, plus a random amount generated in the same range as used for the diamond step. This gives you squares again.
        Parameters:
        map - The array which will be used.
        xSide - The distance between the right and left edge of a diamond.
        ySide - The distance between the upper and lower edge of a diamond.
        randomRange - The random value will be in this range.
        Returns:
        map with squares calculated.

      • cutMap

        public static float[][] cutMap(float[][] map,
               float max,
               float min)
        Sets every float in map which are >max to max and every float which are
        Parameters:
        map - The array which will be used.
        max - The max value.
        min - The min value.
        Returns:
        map with the values modified.
